H0.text: The pistil is the female reproductive structure of a flower.

H1.text: The stamen is the female reproductive structure of a flower.

H2.text: The seed is the female reproductive structure of a flower.

H3.text: The flower is the female reproductive structure of a flower.

A4.text: The gynoecium is the innermost whorl of a flower; it consists of (one or more) pistils and is typically surrounded by the pollen-producing reproductive organs, the stamens, collectively called the androecium.
